item.description:
Reopening Lecture, European Art at Yale

Speaker/Performer: Laurence B. Kanter, Chief Curator and the Lionel Goldfrank III Curator of European Art Description: The first in a series of slide-illustrated talks by the Gallery's curators, which introduce visitors to the collections on display in the expanded museum. Each lecture focuses on a single curatorial area, shining a spotlight on Gallery treasures and providing the context and history of the collections.


FREEÂ 

TOUR STARTS AT 5:30

Parking
In addition to the metered spaces (UNTIL 9:00) on nearby streets, there is a conveniently located garage at 150 York Street (Chapel York Garage.
item.how_to_find_us: meet at the entrance to the lecture hall where the lecture will take place at 5:15, will wear the black and white scarf with piano keys
item.name: Reopening Lecture, European Art at Yale
